title: General election 2017: Results from Shropshire - BBC News
summary: roads to close for weekend 's cosford air show .
firefighters ' equipment stolen during fire station break-in .
wrekin mp mark pritchard planning honeymoon after mid-campaign marriage .

documents.title: drink-drive arrest after girl , 11 , dies
text: drink-drive arrest after girl , 11 , dies

documents.title: watch : pontesbury man creates giant wicker otter
text: a pontesbury man has created a 26ft-long ( 8m ) otter out of branches and twigs and plans to display him at bridgnorth carnival on 24 june .
the work was commissioned by the shropshire wildlife trust , which wants to mount his creation on their float .
author: Genevieve Tudor
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: man released in schoolgirl death investigation
text: a man arrested in connection with the death of a 11-year-old girl in a crash in copthorne , shrewsbury has been released under investigation while police enquiries continue .
the 77-year-old had been questioned on sus of causing death by dangerous driving and driving whilst under the influence of alcohol .
the girl has not yet been named , but her head teacher at st george 's school said it was an `` incredibly difficult time '' for all involved .

documents.title: carnival in shrewsbury tomorrow
text: the shrewsbury carnival takes place tomorrow , with a parade around the town and a show in the quarry .

the procession will start at the park at 14:00 and travel down victoria quay and smithfield , then up castle gates and castle street before turning into the high street and then down shoplatch , bellstone , barker street and bridge street .
the show in the quarry will feature stalls , a fun fair and entertainment in an arena .

documents.title: meetings to discuss the future of women and children 's services
text: open meetings are going to be held in shrewsbury , oswestry and telford to get people 's thoughts about the future of women and children 's services in the county .
they 're being jointly hosted by the shropshire and telford clinical commissioning groups and the first will be in palmer 's cafe in shrewsbury next wednesday .
the ccgs say they want to hear the experiences of parents , their friends and their families and say babies and small children will be catered for at the meetings .

proposals to close the county 's rural maternity units have been put forward , because they are under-used and the future fit review of hospital services has recommended moving specialist women and children 's services from telford to shrewsbury .

documents.title: school investigated 'inappropriate ' actions by teacher
text: newport 's burton borough school says it held an investigation when reports of inappropriate behaviour by an it teacher came to light .

jennifer cann has been given an indefinite suspension from teaching after admitting she failed to `` maintain professional boundaries '' and that she engaged in an `` inappropriate relationship '' with a pupil .

christine carter , the head teacher at burton borough school , said the 30-year-old resigned before a disciplinary process could be completed , but that the investigation by school governors into her conduct was completed .

documents.title: teacher banned after hugging pupil
text: teacher banned after hugging pupil

documents.title: football : afc telford united deny ronaldo interest
text: rumours that cristiano ronaldo might want to leave real madrid , because he is upset at being accused of tax fraud , have prompted all sorts of rumours about potential destinations .
but he wo n't be going to the bucks head - afc telford united have just put out this tweet .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: road race to honour shropshire cyclist
text: a new road cycling race will be run in shropshire on sunday in honour of a local cyclist .
mike jones will be known to many in the sport as the man who set up stan 's cycles in shrewsbury and he now runs a cycling holiday business in the pyrenees with his wife .

the 50 year old got the nickname `` rhino '' because of his aggressive riding style and has won over 200 races including seven midlands titles and has taken part in world and national championship events .
the race will take place on roads near eaton constantine , just outside shrewsbury .

documents.title: football : shrewsbury manager sees 'tough game ' against forest
text: the shrewsbury town manager says he 's expecting a `` tough game '' when his side travel to play nottingham forest in the first round of the league cup .

paul hurst said that even if their opponents tinker with their side for the game , it should be a challenge and that forest was a club `` steeped in history '' that will want to perform better this season .
hurst added it was a game the fans will look forward to and said his players will want to `` give a good account of themselves '' .
obviously when you looked at the seedings that were in place it probably was going to be a tough game , no matter what . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: firefighters release woman 's finger from pram
text: a woman in telford had to call out the fire service after getting her finger stuck in a pram mechanism this lunchtime .
they were called out to lightmoor just before midday and took under 15 minutes to free her .

documents.title: further disruption to shropshire maternity services
text: staff sickness has now led to the closure of bridgnorth 's maternity unit this weekend .
this is on top of the closures of the units in ludlow and oswestry until next wednesday , with women being contacted to offer alternative arrangements .

the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust has also announced that women booked for antenatal scans at the sutton hill children 's centre next tuesday and wednesday will have to go to the princess royal hospital instead , because of `` essential building maintenance work '' .

documents.title: more southwater plans released
text: some new images , showing how telford 's southwater development will be changing , have been released by telford and wrekin council .
here you can see where the new travelodge hotel and activity areas will sit , between the lake and the existing restaurants .
and here is the grassy area where they will be built , as it looked before work started .

documents.title: sunderland to play bury in efl cup
text: sunderland to play bury in efl cup

documents.title: football : shrewsbury drawn away to nottingham forest in league cup
text: shrewsbury town have been drawn to play nottingham forest at the city ground in the first round of the league cup .
it will be the first competitive meeting between the two sides .
shrewsbury were in the pot as one of the unseeded teams in the `` northern '' section this year .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: shrewsbury head teacher reacts to death of 11-year-old pupil
text: the headteacher of st george 's junior school in shrewbury has confirmed that the 11-year-old girl who died after being hit by a car yesterday was a pupil there .
the girl is n't being named at this stage , but sharon munro said she was on her way home when the collision happened .
a 77-year-old man is being held by the police after being arrested on sus of drink driving and causing death by dangerous driving .
this is an incredibly difficult time for us all , but especially for her family and friends .
our thoughts and prayers are with the family and we ask that people respect their privacy at this difficult time . ''

documents.title: football : shrewsbury wait on league cup draw
text: shrewsbury town are ball number 33 for the league cup draw this lunchtime .
they are in the northern half of the draw , which only includes football league clubs at this stage , with the premier league teams joining in later rounds .
last season , shrewsbury went out in the second round of the competition , after losing 1-0 away to sunderland .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: details of further investment in rural broadband 'to be announced soon '
text: shropshire council says it expects to announce soon the details of further investment in rural broadband .
the authority 's been criticised by campaigners angered by what they see is a lack of action since a preferred supplier was chosen in april .
but the council says it 's still completing due diligence on the deal and it expects `` positive information '' soon .
it 's already subsidised bt to the tune of £ 9m for previous parts of the scheme .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: former-witch becomes town councillor
text: a former witch has taken a seat on bishop 's castle town council and says she sees it as a `` new challenge '' .

abbie niaid explained she had been `` developing an interest in politics for some time '' and said , `` i wanted to do something for my community , a community that has helped me greatly since i 've lived here '' .

ms niaid said she 'd been apprehensive before her first meeting , but soon felt comfortable discussing her views and added that pagans elsewhere had shown an interest in politics , but that other towns were `` not as accepting as bishop 's castle '' .
she says she does n't practice witchcraft any more and that she now sees it as a `` simple personal religion '' , joking she does n't go out dancing `` in the nude '' .
it 's a new challenge , a little bit different for me because it 's very much focussed in the real world , rather than in the other realm . ''

documents.title: it teacher banned for 'inappropriate relationship ' with student
text: a former it teacher at the burton borough school in newport who hugged one of the students has been suspended from teaching indefinitely .

the national college for teaching and leadership found 30-year old jennifer cann had `` failed to maintain professional boundaries '' and engaged in an `` inappropriate relationship '' with the pupil , who she met outside school on a number of occasions to tutor them .
while she admitted hugging the pupil , the panel said there was `` no suggestion that there was any sexual element to this '' .
ms cann also admitted giving pupils answers to two test questions .
she is banned from teaching in schools or children 's homes , but can apply to have the prohibition order set aside in two years ' time .

documents.title: bridgnorth bypass roadworks delayed to avoid clash
text: roadworks on the a458 bridgnorth bypass have been delayed by seven days by shropshire council to avoid a clash with work network rail is carrying out on the a49 at onibury .
concerns had been raised because the suggested diversion route around onibury would have taken traffic down the a458 .
the council says two-way traffic lights will be in place on sections of the a458 from 11 july and that the work should now be complete by 10 november .

documents.title: council admits changes need to be made to its plan for the borough 's future
text: telford and wrekin council 's acknowledged that changes need to be made to its plans for the borough 's future .
it comes after a government inspector expressed `` serious concerns '' about its local plan for the next 14 years - describing it as `` flawed '' .
since then , a developer has looked over it and criticised a `` lack of ambition and delivery of affordable homes '' .
telford is one of the highest housing growths of any uk city , i think it 's second in the uk , over the last two years , for delivering on housing growth .
we have an ambition for delivery of affordable homes and we 'll continue to do that .
so i do n't know where that developer is coming from . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man arrested after fatal shrewsbury crash
text: the police have arrested a 77-year-old man from shrewsbury on sus of drink driving after a crash which claimed the life of an 11-year-old girl yesterday afternoon .
he is being held in police custody and ch insp alison davies said officers were trying to establish `` the circumstances of this tragic incident '' .
the girl suffered serious head injuries and died at the royal shrewsbury hospital .

documents.title: young girl dies after being hit by car
text: a young girl has died after being hit by a car on mytton oak road in shrewsbury .
west midlands ambulance service says it was called out at 16:18 yesterday after the 4x4 crashed into the front wall of a garden .
paramedics were there within seven minutes and took her to the royal shrewsbury hospital , but they were unable to save her life .

documents.title: labour 's election hopeful pays tribute to mp jo cox a year after she died
text: labour 's parliamentary candidate in ludlow , julia buckley , said her friend mp jo cox inspired her to stand in this year 's general election .
more than 100,000 community events are taking place across the country this weekend , to mark the first anniversary of jo cox 's death .
the 41 year-old was shot and stabbed outside a library in birstall in yorkshire , as she prepared to hold a constituency surgery .
dr buckley , who came second in the election on 8 june , behind philip dunne , says it was the example jo set that brought her back to politics .
there were three of us , who were friends together and worked for the labour party in our 20s and we were all going to change the world and make a difference and jo did exactly that .
i got a bit distracted with family and day jobs .
so last summer , i decided the best thing i could do was stand up and be counted .
i want to do as much as i can really to make a difference . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: £ 20m inflatable air hangar pumped up in sculpture park
text: a giant , inflatable aircraft hangar , claimed to be the largest structure of its kind in the world , has been pumped up in oswestry .
it 's been created by local firm lindstrand technologies for goodyear , which plans to use it to house its `` blimp '' airship at the company 's headquarters in california .
the hangar is almost nine storey high , longer than a football pitch , made from 73 miles of polyester fabric and cost £ 20m .
a 100ft crane lifted it into place at the sculpture park at the british ironworks centre , near oswestry , to test it .
forty generators took several hours to fill it with air .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: some bright and some cloudy times today , with the potential for sunny spells at times and top temperatures of 22c ( 72f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: bursary to promote educational , cultural and sporting excellence
text: a bursary to help children and young people in the area , who are gifted and talented in education , sports , arts , dance and music has been launched by telford and wrekin council .
it 's being paid for with money saved from reductions to allowances awarded to cabinet members .
applications for the scheme open today and it 's open to all children and young people up to the age of 25 who live in the borough .
the closing date for applications is 31 july .
it 's great that we will be able to use this money that has been saved to help encourage and promote educational , cultural and sporting excellence in the borough . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: car separated from engine in hgv crash
text: a huge crash near whitchurch left an hgv on its side and a car separated from its engine .
west midlands ambulance service said crews arrived to find the car 's engine 20m down the road from the rest of the vehicle
it happened on long lane , the road from bronington to whitchurch , on wednesday evening .
a man in his 20s , who was trapped for 50 minutes , was taken to the royal stoke university hospital suffering from leg injuries .
another man was also taken to hospital with abdominal pain .

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after some evening sunshine it will stay dry tonight , with clear spells developing .
the winds will ease but it will feel cooler than recent nights - lows of 14c ( 57f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: raf cosford bids farewell to station commander
text: there 's been a change of guard at raf cosford today , as the outgoing air commodore mark hunt handed over command of the base and the defence school of aeronautical engineering .
a brief ceremony took place at 11:30 outside the station 's headquarters where command was officially handed over to the new station commander , group captain tone baker .
air cmdr hunt became commandant in 2015 and was responsible for aerospace training for all three services and inspiring the next generation of engineers .
during his time at raf cosford he saw raf cosford progress from an ofsted grade 2 to an outstanding grade 1 .
i am absolutely delighted and feel highly privileged to be taking command as station commander and commandant of dsae .
this is n't my first time in shropshire as i started here as an apprentice in 1987 , and as such it does feel as if i am coming back to my roots . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: suspect in armed police manhunt in bridgnorth arrested
text: one of the suspects police want to talk to in connection with a dangerous driving incident on bridgnorth high street , just over a week ago , has been arrested on sus of stealing a car .
the 22-year-old was arrested on wednesday night and remains in custody .
the arrest is in relation to the theft of a car in walsall at the end of may .
the same car , a white peugeot 308 was driven in the wrong direction down bridgnorth high street before being found abandoned in east castle street on june 7 .
the incident saw armed officers take to the streets and whitburn street was cordoned off for a time as a search for the car was started .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: woman airlifted but children - including two babies - narrowly avoid injury in crash
text: a woman has been airlifted to hospital after the landrover discovery she was in crashed up an embankment and flipped onto its roof .
three children - a five-month-old boy , a 21-month-old girl , and a six-year-old boy - avoided injury but have been taken to hospital as a precaution .
the accident happened on sutton road , just off the a41 in tern hill , near market drayton just after 11:00 this morning .
the 26-year-old woman , who 's believed to have been a passenger in the vehicle , has been airlifted to royal stoke university hospital 's major trauma centre with neck and back pain .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lib dem councillor backs jo swinson for leader
text: local liberal democrat councillor , andy boddington ( below left ) , is backing scottish mp jo swinson ( below right ) to take over as party leader .
it follows the announcement that tim farron is to step down because he says he 's unable reconcile his christian faith with the demands of leading a `` progressive '' liberal party .
andy boddington says although tim farron was popular inside the party , that did n't translate to the electorate .
he believes jo swinson , who returned as an mp last week after losing her seat to the snp in the 2015 general election , is the right person for the job .
when jo gets on stage people smile , they want to applaud .
she 's got that charisma .
she has the skills i think we need . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police probe woman 's hospital death
text: police probe woman 's hospital death
author: Michele Paduano
BBC Midlands health correspondent

documents.title: shropshire hot air balloon club could be revived
text: it 's 30 years since a businessman from oswestry , along with richard branson , made the first-ever crossing of the atlantic in a hot air balloon .
per lindstrand 's effort stands in the guinness book of world records and the interest sparked the formation of the oswestry balloon club .
originally 15 people bought a hot air balloon , which they christened the shropshire lad .
within two years the club grew in popularity and they had between 15 and 18 balloons flying .
the club has since faded away but original members are meeting at weston pools clubhouse in weston at 7:30 tonight to try to revive it .
they 're hoping that anyone interested will come along especially young people .

documents.title: football : cup to be staged as pre-season tournament
text: the shropshire senior cup is being staged as a pre-season tournament this year .
the new saints will play market drayton town and haughmond will face shawbury united in mid july - with the winners of each facing shrewsbury town and afc telford respectively the following week .
afc telford utd won the trophy last year .
they beat shrewsbury town 2-0
this year the final will take place towards the end of the month .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: singer and writer jerry lordan honoured with plaque to mark bbc music day
text: a blue plaque has gone up in shropshire , one of 47 to celebrate music legends being unveiled across the country as part of bbc music day .
the singer and writer jerry lordan has been recognised with a plaque at one of his favourite pubs , the three tuns inn in bishop 's castle .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shropshire leisure centre cash crisis : the future of ten facilities at risk
text: the future of ten of the county 's leisure centres is in serious doubt after shropshire council revealed plans to consider cutting funding entirely .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: in the sun is shining across shropshire
text: it 's been bright with blue skies across much of shropshire this morning , but it will turn cloudier and breezier with a few light showers possible later .
thanks to bbc weather watchers peter steggles for this glorious of longnor and shropshire lass for the beautiful roses in bloom in ludlow .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: temporary maternity closures 'shocking '
text: shropshire health campaigner gill george has called the latest maternity unit closures `` shocking '' and said they were causing `` huge fear and uncertainty '' .
the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust said it had taken the decision to close the units in oswestry and ludlow for a week because of staff sickness .
the units have been hit by a string of overnight and weekend closures over several months .

ms george said it was the responsibility of the hospitals to `` staff the service properly '' and claimed these temporary closures were `` the first step into closing those rural services down altogether '' .

documents.title: £ 20.4m flax mill restoration set to start
text: work to restore shrewsbury 's historic flax mill building will start on monday , after 30 years of campaigning .
the building , built in 1886 , was the first in the world to use an iron frame , which directly led to the creation of high-rise buildings and skyscrapers around the world , historic england says .
the iron , cast at nearby coalbrookdale , was used to help prevent fires caused by highly combustible flax dust .
structural repairs will be carried out to the grade i listed mill building and it 's hoped this will be complete by the end of next year
after that , the £ 20.4m project will see the mill fitted out , while restoration begins on the grade ii listed kiln .
the plan will see a visitor centre built in the currently derelict building , as well as a cafe , activity space and four floors of offices .

documents.title: four-year investigation 'ongoing ' into woman 's death
text: the husband of a woman who died at telford 's princess royal hospital says her patient notes do not reflect what happened on the night she died and west mercia police have spent four years investigating .
carol rowley was 56 and terminally ill with cancer and her husband alan says records suggest treatment was given that he believes was not .
west mercia police says its inquiry is on-going , but no arrests have been made .
the trust , which runs the hospital , said it had fully co-operated with the police since their enquiries began in 2013 and that to date there have been no findings of any wrong doing .
author: Michele Paduano
Health correspondent, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a bright start there 's the possibility of some light showers around lunchtime , before a warm and sunny afternoon .
the pollen count is expected to be very high and top temperatures expected of 20c ( 68f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom
text: we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather between now and 18:00 .
you can comment on our stories and share you by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : shropshire senior cup fixtures finalised
text: this season 's shropshire senior cup will kick off with the new saints taking on market drayton town and haugmond playing shawbury united in the week of 10 july .
the winner of the first match will then play the cup-holders , afc telford united and shrewsbury town await the winners of the other game , with both games to be played in the week of 17 july .
the final will then be played the following week .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: bearded dragon found in shrewsbury garden
text: vets in protective gear have been called out to catch an escaped bearded dragon , which was spotted up a tree in the meole brace area of shrewsbury this morning .
copthorne vets described him as 18 inches long , spiny and angry at being taken out of his tree and said `` two of our nurses had a lot of fun trying to get hold of him '' .
ms said the lizards are usually kept in heated tanks and are n't used to being outside in british weather .

documents.title: flax mill restoration a 'long journey '
text: the man leading historic england 's restoration of shrewsbury 's flax mill , chris smith , says it has been a `` long journey '' to get to this stage , after the closure of the building in 1987 .

a private property developer , shropshire council and english heritage have all put forward plans to bring it back into use , but the building has remained closed and covered in scaffolding until now .

when it was built , historic england says it was the town 's biggest employer and when the flax mill closed in 1886 , it was converted into a maltings business , converting grain into malt for the brewing industry- and that was when the kiln was added .
more recently , it served as a temporary barracks during world war two .
all those people who care about the future of the world 's first cast-iron framed building know just how long a journey it has been to get to this stage . ''

documents.title: in duke makes three stops on shropshire visit
text: it 's been a busy day for the duke of gloucester ( below , left ) , who visited the severn valley railway 's engine shed in highley to hand out awards to volunteers who have completed 50 years of service .
his next task was to officially reopen the museum of iron in coalbrookdale , which has recently been refurbished .
and his last engagement was in shrewsbury , where he was invited to open a number of alms houses built by the drapers .

documents.title: the fine margins of a hung parliament
text: the fine margins of a hung parliament
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: watch : wheelchair athlete excited by london opportunity
text: after a disappointing time at the rio paralym the newport wheelchair athlete ben rowlings says he is excited about the chance to compete at the world championships in london .
he broke a world record for the 5,000m in switzerland last week and believes he 's in good shape for the competition next month .

documents.title: steam ride for royal visitor
text: the duke of gloucester is on his way to highley on the severn valley railway .
the royal train awaits the arrival of hrh duke of gloucester he 'll be climbing aboard no .
7812 erlestoke manor for the trip to highley .
only the reigning monarch is entitled to four , so i 'm told .
is n't there an upper , central lamp supposed to be there - or is that just for er ?

documents.title: ironbridge crash victim has 'serious arm injury '
text: a woman in her 30s whose car ended up on its roof in ironbridge this morning has suffered a serious arm injury , west midlands ambulance service says .
paramedics were called to lincoln hill at 08:15 and said she had been able to get out of the car by herself and was being cared for by passers-by when they arrived .
only one vehicle was involved and nobody else was hurt .

documents.title: flax mill restoration work to start next monday
text: work to restore shrewsbury 's historic flax mill building will start next monday , historic england says .
structural repairs will be carried out to the grade i listed mill building , which will have windows fitted and it 's hoped this will be complete by the end of next year .
once the restoration of the mill is complete , workmen will begin the job of fitting out the building and start on the grade ii listed kiln and on a new car park .
the heritage lottery fund has donated £ 20.7m to the project and plan is for the building to contain a visitor centre , a cafe , activity space and four floors of offices .

documents.title: weather watchers : is summer finally here ?
text: we 've been promised a fine day with plenty of sunshine .
it 's already looking like a beautiful day in longnor ( top ) and ellesmere ( bottom ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: lake being renamed after copyright dispute
text: dearnford lake near whitchurch is changing its name today .
the businessman who owns it has been forced to make the move following a copyright dispute with the shropshire councillor tom biggins , the owner of the nearby dearnford hall .
mr biggins said the presence of the lake next door was causing confusion with his own business and that he had no choice other than to trademark the name to protect his own interests .
rob bebbington has chosen to call it alderford lake , because the area is surrounded by alder trees .
he owns the lake and cafe on site and said the rebranding will cost him up to £ 20,000 .

documents.title: family tribute to son after oswestry road death
text: the family of danny hughes has paid tribute to their `` beautiful son and brother '' after he died on the a483 on 4 june .
police say the 24-year-old from llanfyllin , powys , was on his motorbike when he collided with a black hyundai tucson .
his family said in a statement : `` he was kind and thoughtful , but never sought praise or reward .
he was a very special young man , who touched so many hearts .
rest in peace sweet man . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: britain - share your personal bests ! london 2017
text: this summer , london is hosting the biggest global sporting events of the year - the 2017 world athletics and para athletics championships - and the organisers have launched a scheme to get people involved in athletics right around the country .
it 's called team personal best and the idea is that local sports clubs or community groups across the uk sign up and put on events with an athletics theme .
it does n't have to be a track-and-field meet - it can be a fun run , family sports day , even an event screening or bake sale with activities .
there 's a list of suggestions on the teampb submission page , here .
event participants are then encouraged to share their athletic achievements - no matter how big or small - with the hashtag # teampersonalbest to build a nationwide buzz around the championships .
you can find events near you here and if you want more information about how to get started in athletics , check out our get inspired guide .

documents.title: two maternity units to close for a week
text: the maternity units in oswestry and ludlow will be closing until next wednesday , the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust has announced .
day services for expectant mothers will continue .
these are the latest in a series of temporary closures this year , which are being blamed on `` staff sickness '' .
last week it emerged the hospitals are are considering shutting their rural midwife-led maternity units around the county and replacing them with a system of on-call midwives .
they say the rural maternity units are under-used and that a new rota system would allow them to better cope with staff-sickness .

documents.title: woman trapped in ironbridge crash
text: a woman has been flown to hospital after becoming trapped in her car , following a crash on lincoln hill , ironbridge , this morning .
no other vehicles were involved .
fire crews from telford and wellington were called to the scene at 08:15 .
in a seperate incident , fire crews were called out to a three-vehicle collision on the wombridge road in telford just before 08.30 .
no-one was trapped but one person was taken to hospital with neck pain .
lincoln hill , ironbridge .
rtc road closed.3438

documents.title: unemployment in west midlands rises as uk total falls
text: unemployment in the west midlands has risen , latest figures from the office for national statistics show , despite a fall nationally .
between february and april , there were 6,000 more unemployed people in the region than november to january , giving a total of 166,000 .
across the uk , for the same period , there were 50,000 fewer people out of work with 1.53 million unemployed .
the west midlands figure is also higher than the year before , with an increase of 6,000 compared with february to april 2016 .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: royalty in shropshire today
text: hrh the duke of gloucester is visiting the county today .

he 'll also be officially reopening coalbrookdale 's museum of iron as part of the 50th anniversary celebrations of the ironbridge gorge museum trust .

documents.title: ticket fraud warning over website
text: fans hoping to see rod stewart perform in shropshire are among those believed to have been scammed .
action fraud says goticketsuk.com has sold tickets to several concerts , including rod steward 's gig in shrewsbury earlier this month , but customers have n't received their tickets or a refund .
action fraud is warning customers the site is a scam .
dianne dunderdale , who lives on the shropshire/powys border , says her husband paid £ 560 to the website for rod stewart tickets but they never arrived and are still awaiting a refund .
he 's frustrated that someone could do such a thing , my friend was so upset she was so looking forward to going . ''
author: Kate Tebby
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch the latest weather forecast for the west midlands
text: the whole region will have another fine day with plenty of sunshine .
some fair weather cloud will develop during the afternoon but even then we will see a lot of the sun .
it will be significantly warmer than yesterday - highs of 25c ( 77f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : accident on a458 at acton round
text: reports of heavy traffic on the a458 due to an accident near the turning for muckley cross .
you can expect delays between morville and much wenlock .
to report traffic and travel incidents dial 0330 123 0184 at any time .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: local paper readers honour oswestry 'heroes '
text: a supermarket , a young golfer and a veteran councillor were among the winners in a `` local heroes '' competition voted for by readers of the oswestry advertizer .

hope house was voted the top fundraiser , stan 's superstore in st martins was given an award for its community work , and booka bookshop and the meat man were crowned the top small and larger businesses respectively .
other winners included barbara craig for her work with the annual poppy appeal , up and coming golfer ellie potts and david lloyd for service to the town through his 50 years as a local councillor .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: items found at military site
text: a team of archaeologists from whitchurch museum and archives group have unearthed a bullet casing , lead shot and a fire-pit at a site which was used by the military in the past .
the land , off hospital lane , near prees heath and now owned by the shropshire wildlife trust , was used as a training camp during world war one and became an airfield in world war two .
kirsty brown from the museum and archives group said they 'd also found tiles , along with her favourite item - an old leather winkle- shoe .

documents.title: public asked to choose telford 's 50th birthday logo
text: people in telford are being asked to choose the logo for the town 's 50th birthday celebrations next year .
telford and wrekin council has come up with a shortlist of three designs , which will be put to a vote .
the voting will close at midnight on 22 june and the council will be announcing the winner at the carnival of the giants event in telford town park on 15 july .

documents.title: judy murray visits oswestry for book launch
text: judy murray has paid a visit to oswestry to help with the launch of her new book , telling the story of her family .

the mother of tennis stars andy and jamie murray said `` nobody really thinks '' about the hard work which helped take them to the top of their game and that it was n't easy , growing up in a small scottish town , with little money .
booka books in oswestry was ms murray 's first stop on her tour launching the book knowing the score .
in any individual sport the onus really is on the parents to make things happen for their kids or to create the opportunities . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: ludlow mp keeps job in re-shuffle
text: the ludlow mp philip dunne has kept his job in theresa may 's new government .
he remains a health minister , serving under jeremy hunt .
author: Faith Page
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : young volunteers work on shropshire footpaths
text: a team of young volunteers from shrewsbury school have been carrying out work on bridges and footpaths at alveley this week .
they 're taking part in a community week organised by the school , which involves a range of projects .
author: Genevieve Tudor
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: bishop 's castle could get new first responders
text: a patients ' group in bishop 's castle has been told the town could get new community first responders , after it complained there were none based in the area .
west midlands ambulance service ( wmas ) explained that recruitment had been delayed because a new , national training scheme was being set up , but that it was now up and running .
representatives of wmas said they held a `` very constructive meeting with the bishop 's castle and clun patients ' group to discuss the situation .

documents.title: air show organisers set next year 's date
text: around 50,000 people attended the cosford air show at the weekend , the organisers have said - and a date has been set for next year 's event .
the number of tickets available for the air show was increased this year and organisers prepared for crowds of up to 60,000 - which would have equalled a record for the event .
details about next year 's show , which will be held on 10 june , will be announced in october .

documents.title: new southwater square 'to bring art and fun '
text: the plans for the latest southwater developments were drawn up and approved last year and will include a public square which will `` cater for a range of uses '' , telford and wrekin council , says .
the authority says it will also have `` interactive art '' and a new water feature which will `` provide fun activities for people to get involved in '' .
the new 68-bedroom travelodge will have a bar or restaurant on the ground floor , but the council is still looking for a tenant for it .
work is set to be completed by next spring .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers squad-building continues
text: telford tigers are continuing to build for the new season in the nihl north .
macaulay halford has left the sheffield steeldogs to return to telford and link up with coach tom watkins again .
and defenceman danny rose has agreed to sign up for another year after helping the tigers to the english premier league title last season .

documents.title: company told to stop unauthorised excavation work
text: a planning inspector has told a telford company to stop carrying out excavation work at its base at coalmoor .

telford and wrekin council served an enforcement notice on sp holding ltd in september 2015 , saying it was carrying out the work , with heavy machinary , without planning permission , but the company appealed and a four-day public inquiry was held in january .
the planning inspector has now released his rulings and dismissed the appeal .
he has told sp holding to restore the land to its original condition within 12 months , stop parking its vehicles on the land and pay a portion of the council 's legal costs .

documents.title: coins to mark pit closure anniversary
text: commemorative coins have been struck to mark the 50th anniversary of the closure of ifton pit at st martins .
there will be 500 of them going on sale and a number of events are also being lined up by the ifton colliery commemorative project to mark the closure .

documents.title: 'old-fashioned handshake ' now for stone
text: 'old-fashioned handshake ' now for stone

documents.title: information sessions to explain road closure
text: network rail is holding information sessions this week to answer questions about the planned closure of the a49 at onibury .
the road 's expected to shut for 10 days next month , while repairs are carried out at a level crossing .
there 's a meeting today at 15:00 at ludlow mascall centre , another in onibury tomorrow , and a final one in church stretton on thursday .
under the plans , some drivers will face a 57-mile ( 92km ) diversion which takes them via wooferton towards kidderminster , then northbound via bridgnorth to bayston hill .

documents.title: patient group complaint over first responder shortage
text: the bishop 's castle patients group has told ambulance bosses it is unhappy with the shortage of first responders in the area .
it says the market town does n't currently have a first responder and the nearest lives 20 minutes away .
the group met with west midlands ambulance service yesterday to express its concerns .

documents.title: calls being answered more promptly at surgery
text: test calls to an under-pressure surgery in wellington are now being answered within two to three minutes , health bosses say .
wellington medical practice had been criticised for failing to answer calls promptly .
a report to telford 's health commissioners says a combination of new phone lines and increased awareness of online booking has started to improve things .

documents.title: museum of iron reopens after refurbishment
text: the duke of gloucester will officially reopen the museum of iron tomorrow to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the ironbridge gorge museum trust .
the museum has been completely refurbished .
following the tour of the museum , he 'll meet trustees , volunteers , friends , staff and supporters of the ironbridge gorge museum trust , who 've helped with the refurbishment .

documents.title: arrest after reports of man with gun near carnival
text: a man from telford has been arrested following reports someone was seen with a gun near newport carnival at the weekend , police say .
the west mercia force says it seized a bb gun and a 19 year old was arrested on sus of assault and possession of an imitation firearm .
he has been released `` under investigation '' .
bb guns fire ball bearings or plastic pellets .

documents.title: southwater development : work starts on next phase
text: work starts this week on the latest phase of telford 's southwater development .
a 68-bedroom travelodge hotel will sit between the ice rink and lake , with improvements also planned to the public square next to the site .

BBC Weather presenter

text: it will be a dry evening , with some clear spells and winds continuing to ease .
however , cloud will increase from the west overnight to bring some light rain later , mainly in the north .
tomorrow , will be mostly dry and bright after patchy rain clears in the morning .

BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: spotting the water voles of whitchurch in a car park
text: with whitchurch being heralded as seeing a boost in water vole numbers , i went along and found you can spot them while doing the weekly shop .
the town is a little sanctuary for water voles , with several populations that live around a brook that runs next to the car park of a local supermarket .
i went to meet @ twitterid ( better known as kate long ) to see if she could help me spot one .
after a short while , kate pointed out something furry and brown running along the edge of the water .
it was my first wild water vole sighting !
kate says , as well as being a perfect territory for water voles , their numbers may also be down to the local mink preferring the linear habitat of the nearby canal which bypasses whitchurch .
author: David Gregory-Kumar
Science correspondent, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: hrh the duke of gloucester to visit coalbrookdale museum of iron
text: hrh the duke of gloucester will officially reopen the coalbrookdale museum of iron on wednesday to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the ironbridge gorge museum trust .
the museum has been completely refurbished , with his royal highness meeting the workers who helped restore the building .
following the tour of the museum of iron , he will meet trustees , volunteers , friends , staff and supporters of the ironbridge gorge museum trust , who have helped with the refurbishment .

documents.title: 'outstanding ' out-of-hours gp service 'best in england '
text: dr simon chapple , medical director of shropdoc - a telephone service that covers when gp surgeries are closed - said he was absolutely delighted with an `` outstanding '' rating .
the rating means the service is the highest rated out-of-hours organisation in england .

when you consider the out-of-hours period represents 70 % of the time , and that as a provider we have a patient population of 600,000 , it 's reassuring to me that despite the scale of what we are doing , we are doing such an outstanding job .

text: man admits murder bid after stabbing

documents.title: jobs under threat at carpet manufacturer brintons
text: about 60 jobs are under threat , as a carpet manufacturer looks set to restructure its business `` in a bid to remain market leader '' .
brintons , which has its headquarters in kidderminster ( has entered a 30-day consultation across its sites in worcestershire and telford .
the weaving of axminster carpets production is also set to stop at its site in kidderminster , under the proposals .

in order to maintain and strengthen our position as one of the world 's leading suppliers of bespoke carpets , it is vital we constantly review our business operations and are able to respond to prevailing trading conditions .
we will where possible , offer new employment opportunities at our telford plant . ''
author: Stephanie Barnard
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingman admits attempted murder in bomere heath stabbing
text: a man has pleaded guilty to attempted murder following a stabbing in bomere heath earlier this year .
wayne williams , 54 , of sefton drive in bomere heath , today admitted one charge of attempted murder and another of wounding with intent against two women in march .
the victims survived the attack after one had been stabbed in the chest and another suffered head injuries .
williams appeared at stafford crown court and he 'll be sentenced on 10 july .

documents.title: shrewsbury sign nolan from chesterfield
text: shrewsbury sign nolan from chesterfield

documents.title: no decision on future of shrewsbury control room
text: police and crime commissioner john campion refused to rule out closing shrewsbury fire control room if he was to take on the running of the organisation .
a consultation is open that could see the pcc replace the fire authorities in shropshire , herefordshire and worcestershire .
the police control room in shrewsbury is being replaced by one central one at hindlip hall in worcester .
mr campion said any decision to close or merge fire control rooms would be made by the chief fire officers .

he said staff in shrewsbury currently had little local knowledge of parts of north shropshrie or south shropshire and technology could be better used to support control room staff deploying fire crews , wherever they were based .

documents.title: raf cosford air show : red arrows thrill crowds
text: among the attractions at this weekend 's air show at raf cosford were the red arrows .
if you missed them , we caught them on camera .
author: BBC Midlands Today

text: it 's been a bit of a mixed morning on the weather front - grey skies with some bright patches breaking through .
to illustrate , here are two photos from our bbc weather watchers today , from users foggy in ludlow and shropshire golfer in peplow .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

text: rare water voles found near supermarket

documents.title: air show draws thousands of fans
text: thousands of people turned out at the weekend for the raf cosford air show .
among the events were air displays and ground-based attractions too .
it 's the only air show organised by the raf this year and you can see more from the event on the bbc radio shropshire facebook page .
author: Johnty O'Donnell
Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: firefighters and police officers 'to be protected from cuts '
text: front-line police officers and firefighters will be protected if a plan to replace the fire authority goes ahead , west mercia 's police and crime commissioner says .
a consultation has been launched that could see pcc john campion take over the running of the fire services in shropshire , herefordshire and worcestershire .
he said the change could save £ 500,000 in `` governance '' alone , as well as merging back-office functions such as hr and finance .
he said job losses behind the scenes were possible , but would not affect front-line officers and firefighters .
our fire authorities have laid some good foundations , but it 's clear to me that our communities are not getting the most effective , efficient services they could . ''

documents.title: football : shrewsbury town set for portugal training camp
text: shrewsbury town have booked a week-long training camp in portugal at the end of the month .
they 'll be flying out for a training camp , with a match also arranged out there .
i know there 'll be some cynics out there saying 'why do you have to go away to portugal to do that ? '
but the importance is two-fold .
one , the work they 'll be doing , the fitness work and the first early signs of probably organisation and also the bonding side . ''
author: BBC Shropshire

documents.title: water vole 'thriving ' in shropshire town
text: a rare mammal , considered to be at risk of extinction , is thriving in a part of shropshire .
the water vole , best known as ratty from wind in the willows , is considered to be under threat as , since the 1970s , numbers are thought to have declined by more than 90 % .
however in whitchurch , numbers are so high that , at a brook beside a supermarket car park , locals can have very close encounters with this rarest of native mammals .
experts in the area say it 's down to the stream being a perfect place for water voles .
author: David Gregory-Kumar
Science correspondent, BBC Midlands Today

text: pcc aims to oversee fire services

documents.title: high or very high pollen levels forecast this week
text: watch out hayfever sufferers - it 's not going to be a good week in general as the pollen levels look to be between high and very high for most of the uk .
you can check the latest levels at any time by going to the bbc weather website and then selecting your area of the country .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: police commissioner could oversee fire service to save money
text: west mercia 's police and crime commissioner could take control of the fire services in herefordshire and worcestershire and shropshire , as a consultation about the proposals is launched today .
john campion says the move would save the taxpayer £ 4m a year .
the proposed changes would see john campion become the commissioner for police , fire and crime in herefordshire , worcestershire , shropshire and telford & wrekin .

mr campion says that by disbanding the two local fire and rescue authorities he could help drive forward collaboration between the police and fire services , particularly with back office efficiencies .
the consultation on the proposals will run until mid september .
author: Gavin Kermack
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: firefighters ' equipment stolen during fire station break-in
text: rescue equipment has been stolen from a fire engine during a break-in in albrighton , according to shropshire fire and rescue service .

the burglary happened in the early hours of friday and the service has moved to tell the public there is no need to crowdfund for replacement equipment and fire cover will not be affected by the theft .

documents.title: chance to see inside a piece of history in shrewsbury this weekend
text: you can see a hidden historical gem in shrewsbury this weekend .
the national trust is opening up the town walls tower on saturday and sunday between 11:00 bst and 15:00 .
the tower would have been the first line of defence against invading armies , warning shrewsbury castle about approaching danger .
laura turner , from the national trust , said the attraction was normally only open for six days a year .

documents.title: heritage railway meets £ 1m target
text: the severn valley trust say it has met the £ 1m fundraising target set by the heritage lottery fund ( hlf ) .
the lottery fund has promised to match every pound donated to the heritage line 's endowment future fund , to reach a total of £ 1m .
the deadline to meet the target was the end of june
our ultimate goal is to raise £ 10m for the endowment future fund , as we believe that would produce enough income to alleviate worries over the railway 's future .
although the hlf match funding has now reached its limit , we can still claim 25 % extra gift aid on donations , and i encourage people to continue to donate to the svr 's future wellbeing . ''

documents.title: election panel : your thoughts on the results
text: in the run-up to the general election , the bbc shared the thoughts of voters in an election panel that offered a range of political views drawn from across the nation .
today voters were asked for their views on the result and how they felt about the future .
here 's the view from the west midlands
anne , coventry : `` fearful .
there has been so much damage done to personalities who need to work together to create a working government .
i believe that our eu relationships are damaged beyond repair .
and all this caused by the arrogance of one person who thought it was a foregone conclusion . ''
b john , walsall : `` as i expected and looking forward to a better future with a labour government . ''
dave , stoke-on-trent : it 's a tough call this particular election .
each party has to step up and present a good manifesto and to understand what the people of great britain want . ''
paul , shrewsbury : `` extremely disappointed that the country is stil half full of idiots who vote conservative . ''
tarz , birmingham : `` mayhem let us down , she should resign and amber rudd should be in charge .
mayhem is all talk and no substance .
we are left with no one in charge , so they will have to horse trade with dup and form a government . ''

documents.title: man taken to hospital after telford crash
text: a man was taken to hospital today after a crash involving a motorcycle and a light goods vehicle in telford .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: town centre road to shut for power line upgrade
text: part of shrewsbury town centre is set to close this summer to allow new power lines to be put in .
shropshire council said it was part of a £ 285,000 upgrade , which involves replacing transformers , switchgear and cables in one of the town 's main substations , near the market hall .
work starts on 26 june and set to last for 16 weeks .
part of shoplatch will shut from sunday 13 august 2017 to thursday 17 august 2017 , and saturday 2 september to friday 8 september .

documents.title: ludlow charity appeals after vandals smash shop windows
text: a shropshire charity has issued an appeal for help after vandals smashed its shop windows causing damage estimated at £ 2,000 .
renaissance , in tower street , ludlow , is part of the furniture scheme charity and was targeted along with other businesses during the vandalism spree .
james cooper , from the scheme , said it was insured but the charity had suffered a dip in sales since the attack .

documents.title: temporary road closure needed for raf cosford air show on sunday
text: final preparations are under way at raf cosford ahead of sunday 's air show
due to recent changes to the rules display teams including the raf aerobatic team and the red arrows will be flying on a different axis of the site this weekend .
the raf says this means a small section of the a464 will be closed to traffic between 13:45 and 14:45 on sunday .
a diversion will be signposted .

documents.title: award for firefighter who talked man out of 30ft jump into water
text: a `` cool-headed '' firefighter who stopped a young man from jumping off a bridge into the river severn in shrewsbury has won an award .
steve wesley saved the man 's life by talking to him for 10 minutes and persuading him not to jump 30 feet into the water .
he received the chief fire officer 's commendation at last night 's shropshire fire and rescue service awards .

documents.title: midwife-led units closed due to staff sickness and shortages
text: two of shropshire 's midwife-led units are closed today due to illness and staff shortages .
services for women due to give birth and post-natal care services are suspended at ludlow 's mlu until 20:00 on friday .
similar services in oswestry will not resume until 08:00 next tuesday .
day services for expectant mums will continue as normal .
the trust which runs shropshire 's main hospitals is proposing to temporarily shut all mlus around the county and replace them with a system of on-call midwives .

documents.title: conservative success in ludlow and west worcestershire
text: conservatives can take some solace from ludlow and tenbury as they consider a dreadfully disappointing general election .
author: Ludlow & Tenbury Wells Advertiser

documents.title: tory mp dubs hung parliament a 'hell of a mess ' despite county-wide cleansweep
text: north shropshire 's owen paterson was returned for a sixth term as an mp overnight .
he conceded it was hard to celebrate with the tories ' overall performance .
speaking before theresa may 's latest statement , he said : `` the rest of the night is a hell of a mess .
we 've lost some good friends too .
`` people like julian brazier in canterbury and stewart jackson in peterbrough are really good guys and we 've done good stuff in parliament . ''

documents.title: 'strong relationship ' between dup and conservatives - may
text: theresa may says the conservative party and the dup will work together , having `` enjoyed a strong relationship over many years '' .
brexit negotiations will continue , on the same timetable as before , says mrs may .
the conservatives and dup have a combined 329 seats - 326 is traditionally seen as the benchmark to form a majority government .
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: breakingtheresa may says she is forming a government
text: theresa may says her government will `` provide certainty '' and work to keep the country `` safe and secure '' .
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: conservatives keep all seats in shropshire
text: shropshire continues to be covered by five conservative mps following yesterday 's general election .
author: Shropshire Live

documents.title: wrekin mp planning 'a slightly more expensive honeymoon '
text: the wrekin mp mark pritchard got married mid-way through the general election , on 13 may and had to give up his honeymoon to campaign for the seat .
he said it had been a `` baptism of fire '' for his wife and joked that he 'd given up the dordogne for supporting a fellow-candidate in dudley and newport , rhode island for newport shropshire .
now that the election is over he said he expected it would be a `` slightly more expensive honeymoon '' .

documents.title: ludlow 's record-breaking return for tories
text: while some votes across the country ( including telford ) were close , ludlow was n't one of them .
philip dunne attracted 31,433 votes - a record for the seat .
his majority of 19,286 is also believed to be a record .
some parliamentary colleagues must be looking on with a degree of envy .

documents.title: north shropshire candidate says corbyn has changed politics
text: the man who stood for labour in the north shropshire constituency , graeme currie , said jeremy corbyn had `` changed politics '' and he had proved he was fit to be prime minister .
mr currie increased the labour share of the vote by 11 % , but was comfortably beaten by conservative owen paterson .
and he also said that as more people had seen mr corbyn on the campaign trail , more people had come to like him .
politics has changed in this country and what we 've seen now is a vote for hope .
jeremy corbyn has proved himself to be an honest , decent and principled man who is actually fit to lead this country . ''

documents.title: political arithmetic - can tories or labour get the support they need ?
text: the bbc 's political research unit has been looking at the projected results and doing the arithmetic to work out whether the conservatives or labour could get enough votes to get their laws passed .
if the projections are correct , the conservatives would have enough support in parliament if they secured the backing of the dup :
total : 329 seats
but a progressive alliance behind labour would fall short :
total : 313
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: lib dem candidate says election result irrelevant to brexit talks
text: the woman who stood for the liberal democrats in ludlow says the result of the general election makes no difference to britain 's chances of securing a good brexit deal .
heather kidd said it would be theresa may 's skills as a negotiator , not her parliamentary majority which would decide the outcome of the negotiations with the other eu countries .
mrs kidd also said that she always believed the decision to call a general election on the pretext of securing a stronger brexit mandate was a mistake .
i do n't think it 's going to make the blindest bit of difference .
it was 27 to one before , it 's going to be 27 countries to us now . ''

documents.title: lucy allan sees off labour challenge and holds seat
text: conservative lucy allan has been named mp for telford after a tense election night that kept everybody guessing until the final moments .

documents.title: north shropshire mp wants to get on with brexit
text: theresa may might not have got the parliamentary backing she wanted , ahead of the brexit negotiations , but the re-elected mp for north shropshire says people want her to get on with it regardless .
owen paterson was a vocal supporter of the leave campaign and said the millions of people who voted to leave the eu would lose faith in politics if the government did n't deliver .
mr paterson refused to be drawn on where he thought the election left theresa may personally , rather saying he wanted time to digest the full results from the night and how they broke down .
it was a gutsy decision to call an election , but it just did n't turn out as expected . ''

documents.title: breakingukip leader resigns after campaign failures
text: paul nuttall has resigned as ukip leader after his party failed to gain a single seat in westminster .

documents.title: defeated labour candidate : 'i gave it a good shot '
text: the defeated labour candidate in telford said he `` gave it a good shot '' after losing to the conservatives by 720 votes .
kuldip sahota said he believed the lack of a ukip candidate this time around had helped lucy allan across the line , while praising the campaign run by his party leader , jeremy corbyn .

in response to suggestions that labour was regretting rejecting a pre-election deal from the greens offering not to stand , mr sahota said it might have helped him win the seat , but that the party nationally did not want to pursue it .

documents.title: theresa may to head to buckingham palace
text: political editor laura kuenssberg says theresa may is expected to head to buckingham palace today to speak to the queen , `` with the understanding she can form a government '' .
this is a result of conversations that have been taking place with the dup over the past hours , though it is `` not necessarily an attempt to form a formal coalition .
`` the dup have no wish to see theresa may out of office and no wish to work with jeremy corbyn , '' added laura .
author: Election 2017

documents.title: how green vote could have given labour telford win
text: revisiting the deal offered by the green party to step aside in favour of labour , these charts show how just a few votes could have made a difference .
the conservatives won the seat with a majority of 720 votes , while the greens polled 898 .

documents.title: lib dem candidate praises labour leader
text: there 's been praise for jeremy corbyn from the defeated lib dem candidate in north shropshire , tom thornhill .
he said the labour leader had `` gone out and given a really hopeful , positive message '' during the election campaign .
mr thornhill contrasted that with the performance of theresa may over the past month and a half and said all she offered was `` luke warm gruel '' .
she really has phrased it almost as a presidential campaign .
she was saying 'strengthen my hand , build me up , strengthen my majority ' and of course that is n't how a parliamentary democracy works and i think it 's really backfired . ''

documents.title: greens say labour will 'regret ' rejecting electoral deal
text: labour 's decision to reject a deal with the green party probably cost it victory in telford , according to the man standing for the greens .
the conservatives held on to the seat by just 720 votes , after turning down an offer from luke shirley to step aside to help labour .
he ended up winning 898 votes and mr shirley said `` we assume the green votes would have gone to labour '' and that he thought would have made the difference .
in return , the greens wanted labour not to stand in certain council wards in local authority elections in 2019 .
the labour party in telford has n't commented on the deal since the general election result .
i think they will regret not taking the offer more seriously with hindsight . ''

documents.title: hung parliament : q & a guide to what happens when no-one wins the election
text: the general election has ended in a hung parliament , meaning no party can reach an overall majority .
so what happens now ?
well bbc news has been examining all the questions , from who gets first go at putting together a deal to how long it 'll take .
read what 's next for the uk here on the bbc website .
author: Election 2017

documents.title: owen paterson says may 'justified ' in calling snap election
text: owen paterson is back to represent north shropshire for a sixth time and said afterwards that he thought theresa may did the right thing in calling the snap election - but that the end result was a `` hell of a mess '' .
he said the prime minister had been getting `` significant '' internal opposition and opposition in europe and was right in wanting a stronger mandate .
mr paterson said it was too soon to talk about mrs may 's future as the party leader .
but the leave campaigner he said he now hoped the government could get on with the job of delivering brexit .

documents.title: defeated labour candidate 'inspired by jo cox '
text: the defeated labour candidate in the ludlow constituency says it was her friendship with jo cox which convinced her to stand in this election .

dr julia buckley helped the party finish runners-up in the conservative safe seat for the first time in 47 years and explained `` last summer i decided the best thing i could do was stand up and be counted '' .
dr buckley works at wolverhampton city council , but said she had been an enthusiastic campaigner for the party in the past .
there were three of us who were friends together and we worked for the labour party in our twenties and we were all going to change the world and make a difference and jo did exactly that .
i got a bit distracted with family and day jobs . ''

documents.title: kawczynski calls for unity ahead of brexit talks
text: daniel kawczynski is back as the shrewsbury mp and says his priorities will be getting a new relief road for the town and seeing the review of shropshire 's hospitals through to a conclusion .
but he also said that brexit was the most pressing issue for the next government and he argued british voters would want all political parties to get together ahead of the negotiations .
mr kawczynski admitted the conservative campaign could have gone a lot better , but said theresa may had been `` very straight '' with the electorate and was a `` very experienced politician '' .
we do need a period of stability and i think all the political parties now have to act in a sensible way in the house of commons with the negotiations over brexit starting in 11 days time . ''

i think the labour party have some good people in locally , moderate people .
but they appear to have been hijacked by the hard left , the extreme left . ''

documents.title: telford mp pleased with 'tight ' win after 'difficult night '
text: a victorious lucy allan said she was pleased with the way the conservative vote has held up in the west midlands on what she called a `` difficult night '' for the party .
she held on to the telford seat by 720 votes - just 10 down on 2015 .

i arrived at the count fairly comfortable about the likelihood of winning , because of everything i 've heard for the last six weeks on the doorstep .
and as soon as the boxes began to be opened it was quite clear that this was going to be an incredibly tight contest . ''

text: the returning conservative mp for ludlow , philip dunne , has called the result for his party `` very disappointing '' but he was pleased to see shropshire remain blue .

documents.title: shrewsbury and atcham : 'care for the elderly should be a priority '
text: before the election , we went out and about asking people what would make them vote .
catherine moore , 68 , from shrewsbury is retired .
she was a primary school teacher for 30 years and later worked as a civil servant at the child support agency .
she said affordable care for the elderly was important to her and that the older she gets , the more she thinks about her own care and how it will be financed .
she said the future of local hospitals was also a big concern .
`` there 's friction between shrewsbury and telford and what 's going to happen to various departments , '' she said .
`` what sort of options will i have ?
i have n't got any immediate family and with all of us anything could happen at any time - you never know when you might need it . ''

documents.title: what is election swing ?
text: you 'll hear a lot about swing on election night so what is it ?
in a nutshell it 's an expression in percentage terms of the number of voters who need to swap sides in an election for a seat to change hands .
for example - the conservatives need a swing of 3 % to take blanktown from labour .
to put it another way three voters in every hundred need to switch ( or swing ) to the conservatives from labour in blanktown to put it into the blue column .
marginal seats ( or swing seats as they are sometimes known ) are the ones where the contest is so close that only a small percentage of voters need to switch to decide the outcome .
these are the ones journalists and politicians get excited about on election night and there are a lot of them in the west midlands region .
in two straight two party contests calculating the swing is fairly straightforward but in an increasingly complicated multi-party world swing can sometimes be difficult to calculate !
author: Nick Watson
Sunday Politics Midlands

documents.title: telford : tories to defend majority of just 730
text: telford is the only seat in shropshire with any realistic chance of changing hands ; lucy allan is defending a majority of 730 for the conservatives .

documents.title: how the bbc reports polling day
text: the bbc , like other broadcasters , is n't allowed to report details of campaigning while the polls are open .
the bbc is required by electoral law to adopt a code of practice , ensuring fairness between candidates and that is particularly important on polling day .
the code of practice is contained in more detailed election guidelines which are written and published for each election - and they include guidance on polling day , here .
on polling day specifically , the bbc does n't report on any of the election campaigns from 00:30 until polls close at 22:00 on tv , radio or bbc.co.uk or on social media and other channels .
read more on what the bbc does today here .

text: when 33-year-old andrew green went missing from his farm in chorley , nearly a year ago , hundreds of people helped the family and police search 2,000 acres of nearby woodland and farmland .
volunteers also turned out to help his family bring in the harvest and there were messages of support from people as far away as australia .
an inquest earlier today heard his relationship with his partner had broken down and concluded he took his own life in nearby woods .

documents.title: inquest concludes missing bridgnorth man took his own life
text: an inquest in shrewsbury has concluded a 33-year-old father of two took his own life in woods near bridgnorth .
andrew green from yew tree farm in chorley went missing in june last year , but his body lay undiscovered for nine months despite numerous searches and appeals .
the body was eventually discovered by a hunter , tracking deer in sidbury planting woods .

the workmen also had to get stuck in with shovels and buckets and it took a week to clear it all out .

documents.title: midwife units could close and be replaced with on-call midwives
text: the trust that runs shropshire 's main hospitals is proposing to shut its midwife-led maternity units around the county and replace them with a system of on-call midwives who 'd come out when needed .
health officials insist it 's not a permanent move , and it is n't pre-empting the outcome of a review into the future of the services .

the trust says more women now choose to give birth at the consultant-led unit at the princess royal hospital in telford and it needs to make sure enough staff are in place there , rather than in units which often do n't see a birth for days or weeks .
